thread.title: Portland man arrested over alleged 'sexually explicit' child texts in Wisconsin
thread.title_full: Portland man arrested over alleged 'sexually explicit' child texts in Wisconsin | OregonLive.com

author: David Greenwald | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Portland man arrested over alleged 'sexually explicit' child texts in Wisconsin
text:
A Portland man was arrested on Friday in Shawano County, Wisconsin, on charges of using a computer to facilitate a child sex crime and child enticement, according to the local sheriff's department.
Authorities claim Nicholas Ray Alexander Bennett had been coaching a basketball camp in the area. The 23-year-old allegedly began texting one of the camp's 13-year-old attendees in a conversation that turned "provocative," Sheriff Adam Bieber said in a statement .
The boy's mother reportedly alerted authorities to the text messages on Thursday, and the sheriff's department took over the conversation—which allegedly became "sexually explicit"—to arrange a meeting, and arrest, on Friday night.
"In this case, a vigilant mother identified that a provocative conversation was being held with her son and took the actions necessary to prevent both immediate and perhaps future victimization," Bieber said.
A mug shot has not yet been released.
The Shawano Sheriff's Department has been in the midst of an effort to stop digital child predators, arresting six suspects in total in the last three weeks.
-- David Greenwald
